pageContent: Purpose: Living with untreated prostate cancer (PCa) may cause anxiety and uncertainty in men undergoing active surveillance (AS). Developing a psychosocial support program for such patients might promote psychosocial well-being and patient engagement. This review aims to identify interventions with the potential to influence the psychosocial burden of prostate cancer patients undergoing AS.

metaData.source:
Prediction of erectile function following treatment for prostate cancer
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/21934053/
